Package gamePackage

Class Computer

java.lang.Object
gamePackage.Player
gamePackage.Computer
public class Computer extends Player
The Computer class represents a player that is a computer player. This allows the computer player to be identified and make decisions. This sub-class provides methods to make the decisions for the computer player.
Version:
15.01.2025
Author:
Anne McCubbin

  • Method Details

    • aceChoice

      public void aceChoice(ArrayList<Integer> possibleValues, int aceCount)
      Determines computer player's choice when they have an Ace, or several aces. Aces are automatically valued at 11, so a players possibleValues will be (the total of their non-ace cards) + (aceCount*11). A player could have up to four aces (default valued at 44), but for any number of aces, only the smallest two options could be under 21. If the larger of these two options is less than or equal to 21, this is chosen. Otherwise the smallest option is chosen, which is with each ace valued at 1. The player's handTotalValue is set to their choice.
      Parameters:
      possibleValues - An ArrayList of the possible totals of the player's hand.
      aceCount - The number of aces the player has.

    • hitStandChoice

      public String hitStandChoice(int value)
      Determines computer player's choice between hit' or 'stand'. If the computer's hand is valued at 17 or over, they 'stand'. Otherwise they choose to 'hit'.
      Parameters:
      value - The total value of the player's hand.
      Returns:
      choice The player's choice between 'stand' or 'hit.
